node.title: Diesel crisis threatens to grind Australia to a halt, transport industry warns
node.description: The transport industry is warning of a potential crisis that could stall the nation's diesel trucking fleet, as a key chemical used to remove pollution from their exhausts is running out.

node.title: Feds opened civil inquiry into Andrew Cuomo sexual harassment claims
node.description: Department of Justice's "ongoing investigation" into claims against the former New York governor is revealed in a contract between the current governor's office and a law firm.

node.title: Can We Pedal Any Faster?
node.description: Citi Bike tries to keep up with New Yorkers’ new love of bicycling.

node.title: How Long Can Students Wait for Australia to Reopen?
node.description: As the Omicron variant heralds more uncertainty, international students weigh up their options.

node.title: Covid-19 updates: Auckland should be at green setting - Luxon
node.description: The new leader of the National Party is questioning the government's call to put Auckland into the red setting under the traffic light system, as the city emerges from four months of lockdown today.

node.title: After 17 calls in an hour, help arrived for scared businesses
node.description: Some small businesses have come forward with concerns police are taking too long to arrive when they call for help.

node.title: First case of Omicron COVID-19 variant recorded in Canberra
node.description: ACT Health confirms an Omicron COVID-19 infection in the territory, in an individual who has not travelled overseas.

node.title: ICU funding may be too much, too late - health professionals
node.description: There are fears from health professionals that the government's sudden boost in hospital funding to prepare for Covid-19 cases is overly-ambitious so late into the pandemic.

node.title: Bee Courtship Sees Male Almost Get Cooked Alive in Ball of Competitors
node.description: The digger bee's quest to find a partner was filmed as part of the Discovery+ series "The Mating Game."

node.title: ‘Diary of a Wimpy Kid’ Review: Growing Pains
node.description: In this Disney animated feature from the best-selling series of books, the lead character fearfully enters middle school.

node.title: A Slow-Motion Climate Disaster: The Spread of Barren Land
node.description: Brazil’s northeast, long a victim of droughts, is now effectively turning into a desert. The cause? Climate change and the landowners who are most affected.

node.title: Philippine Court Allows Maria Ressa to Attend Nobel Peace Prize Ceremony
node.description: The decision came after days of growing international pressure on the government to allow the journalist to attend the ceremony in Norway.

node.title: Number of Omicron cases in NSW rises to 13 as cluster at western Sydney school grows
node.description: Four new cases of Omicron are confirmed in NSW, including two more students at the Regents Park Christian School, with urgent testing underway on a further 10 COVID-positive students.

node.title: Courts to operate under transitional Covid-19 protocols until end of January
node.description: The country's courts need more time to set up the infrastructure to operate under the traffic light system.

node.title: Indigenous health service slams 'lack of respect' in Wilcannia COVID response
node.description: An Aboriginal health care provider based in far west NSW has made a scathing submission about its public health counterpart to a NSW parliamentary inquiry.

node.title: ACT records one case of Omicron COVID-19 variant
node.description: ACT Health confirms an Omicron COVID-19 infection in the territory, in an individual who has not travelled overseas.

node.title: Auckland cinema chain plans to expand
node.description: A local cinema chain is pushing ahead with expansion plans, despite the challenges caused by the pandemic.

node.title: A Play With Music by a Convicted Murderer: Was It Worth It?
node.description: By asking the singer Bertrand Cantat to contribute to his latest show, the director Wajdi Mouawad has overshadowed his own production.

node.title: Trevor Noah Says Omicron Might Not Be So Bad
node.description: Noah said that new strains are like streaming new TV shows: “You gotta stick with it the first couple of weeks and see where it goes.”

node.title: Canary Islands becomes open-air lab for tech-savvy volcanologists
node.description: The ultimate goal on La Palma is to use a unique window of opportunity to better understand volcanic eruptions: how they form, develop and, even more crucially for the islanders, how and when they end.

node.title: Theo Hayez 'not a risk-taker', inquest hears
node.description: Theo Hayez's family says evidence validates their concerns over the missing backpacker's "strange" actions.

node.title: Binjari elder's COVID-19 death mourned as 'deep sadness' spreads across the NT
node.description: The tight-knit Binjari community, near Katherine, mourns the death of a 78-year-old Aboriginal woman who succumbed to health complications related to COVID last night.

node.title: New community COVID case detected on Brisbane's bayside, contact tracing locations named
node.description: A new community case is confirmed in Queensland, with a public health alert issued for contact tracing locations in Capalaba, in the city of Redland, on Brisbane's bayside.

node.title: Man's maximum sentence for indecent assult overturned on appeal
node.description: A man who was sentenced to seven years' prison for touching the hand, back and arm of a sleeping woman has had his sentence cut to 15 months on appeal.

node.title: 'The hero of their own story': Why not a disabled Disney princess?
node.description: Hannah Diviney is pushing for Disney to develop a disabled princess character.

node.title: As protesters prepare to 'reclaim the flag', Eureka's 167yo legacy remains contested
node.description: Ever since blood was shed at the Eureka Stockade in 1854 the spirit of the rebellion and its iconic flag have been co-opted by groups of all stripes. As today's anniversary in Ballarat shows, the controversy is alive and well.

node.title: South Australia announces four new COVID-19 infections including mystery case
node.description: SA Health is boosting COVID testing in Adelaide's southern suburbs after a mystery infection was one of four new cases reported today.

node.title: BHP's vaccine mandate unlawful
node.description: The full bench of the Fair Work Commission has found a decision by mining giant BHP to make vaccinations at a Hunter Valley mine mandatory was not lawful or reasonable.

node.title: Courts to operate under transitonal Covid-19 protocols until end of January
node.description: The country's courts need more time to set up the infrastructure to operate under the traffic light system.

node.title: Preliminary designs revealed for Christchurch stadium
node.description: Christchurch City Council has revealed four preliminary design images for the long-awaited 30,000 seat Canterbury Multi-Use Arena.
